summary: This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank Private Bank regarding National Enterprise Systems, LLC (NES) and its regulatory actions. It details various disciplinary actions taken against NES and its affiliates for violations of financial regulations, including fines and lawsuits related to debt collection practices. The document highlights the critical risk priority associated with NES and its history of legal issues.

persons.name: Richard Cordray
persons.context: Richard Cordray is mentioned in connection with lawsuits against National Enterprise Systems, Inc. for unlawful debt collection practices.

persons.name: Attorney General McGraw
persons.context: Attorney General McGraw is referenced for suing NES for using illegal debt-collection tactics.

connections.description: Richard Cordray, as Attorney General, sued NES for violating consumer protection laws.
Attorney General McGraw's Consumer Protection Division sued NES for illegal debt-collection tactics.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed Against NES
events.description: Ohio Attorney General Richard Cordray sued NES for harassing Ohioans in its attempts to collect debts.

events.title: Consumer Protection Division Lawsuit
events.description: Attorney General McGraw's Consumer Protection Division sued NES for using illegal strong-arm debt-collection tactics.

keyFacts: National Enterprise Systems, Inc. was sued for using illegal debt-collection tactics, including telephone harassment.
Richard Cordray, as Attorney General, filed lawsuits against NES for violating consumer protection laws.
Attorney General McGraw's Consumer Protection Division also took legal action against NES for unlawful practices.
